poem:
Title: On a Stage in Soho 

In Soho a stage once reeked 
of wit turned sour, 
a comic's jest bitten by its own fang.
Do we not sit in darkness to laugh, not cower?
A flag fluttered, an outstretch silent in clamour,
Apologies now echo the theatre's marbled tower.
May laughter be free, not chained to power.
